oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1956-08-25 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from August 25, 1956. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Roy Acuff (host/performer) with his Smoky Mountain Boys, guest performers Johnnie & Jack with Ruby Wells and Kitty Wells, and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Pap's Jug Band, June Carter, and Bashful Brother Oswald. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: June Carter; Kitty Wells; Bashful Brother Oswald; Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Roy Acuff introduces June Carter -- Comedy routine (June Carter, Roy Acuff) -- Roy Acuff introduces Kitty Wells -- Searching (For Someone Like You) (Kitty Wells) -- Roy Acuff introduces Bashful Brother Oswald -- Columbus Stockade Blues (Bashful Brother Oswald) -- Voter registration P.S.A. (Grant Turner) -- Roy Acuff talks -- Stay A Little Longer (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Closing statement (Roy Acuff) -- Cavalier Cigarettes commercial -- Station announcements -- Stephens Work Clothes jingle (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Brasfield, Rod; Bashful Brother Oswald; Pap's Jug Band; Forrester, Howdy, 1922-1987; Acuff, Roy; Johnnie & Jack; Wright, Johnnie, 1914-2011; Wright, Ruby (Vocalist); Anglin, Jack, 1916-1963; Wells, Kitty; Wells, Ruby; Smoky Mountain Boys; Riddle, Jimmy, 1918-1982; Cash, June Carter, 1929-2003
